body:
In Helm 3, `helm repo add` does not use the correct `getter.Getter` provided by helm plugins to retrieve the `index.yaml` file.

For example, https://github.com/hayorov/helm-gcs works with Helm 2 but fails in Helm 3 with the following error:

```
helm repo add test-gsc gs://some-gcs-bucket
Error: looks like "gs://some-gcs-bucket" is not a valid chart repository or cannot be reached: Get gs://some-gcs-bucket/index.yaml: unsupported protocol scheme "gs"
```

Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-alpha.2", GitCommit:"97e7461e41455e58d89b4d7d192fed5352001d44", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.12.7"}
```
Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.0", GitCommit:"fc32d2f3698e36b93322a3465f63a14e9f0eaead", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-03-27T00:13:18Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.10-gke.5", GitCommit:"5aa3a95d828fe45aab3611dfc4ebdc0341fe1507", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-29T17:25:39Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8b4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): Not relevant
title: Helm 3: "helm repo add" only uses HTTP getter to download repository index
